Title: Mobile OS maker Jolla is back and building an AI device
Text:
Jolla's AI Device: A Private Cloud for Your Life

At the bustling MWC 2024, a new kind of AI device is making waves, promising to revolutionize the way we interact with technology. Meet JollaMind², a sleek black box that aims to be your personal AI assistant, safeguarding your privacy and unlocking the power of generative AI.

A Private Haven for Your Data

In an era where data is the new gold, JollaMind² stands as a guardian of your personal information. This device acts as a private cloud, securely storing your emails, calendar, contacts, and other sensitive data. Its AI capabilities are powered by open-source large language models, ensuring that your data remains within the confines of your device, away from prying eyes.

Unleashing the Potential of Generative AI

JollaMind² harnesses the transformative power of generative AI, allowing you to interact with your data in natural language. Ask questions, receive insightful responses, and gain valuable insights from your personal information. The device's AI assistant proactively surfaces relevant information, helping you stay organized, productive, and informed.

Privacy and Security at the Core

JollaMind² places privacy and security at the forefront of its design. Unlike traditional AI assistants that process data on remote servers, JollaMind² keeps everything local. This eliminates the risk of data leaks and unauthorized access, giving you complete control over your information.

A Glimpse into the Future of Mobile

JollaMind² represents a bold step towards the future of mobile technology. It challenges the traditional app-centric model by introducing a new paradigm where AI takes center stage. This device has the potential to reshape the way we interact with our devices, making them more intuitive, personalized, and secure.

Availability and Pricing

JollaMind² is expected to make its official debut on May 20, 2023, marking a decade since Jolla's first mobile phone announcement. Pre-orders are likely to open on the same day, with shipping anticipated in Q4 2023. The device will be priced below €300, making it accessible to a wide range of users.

Jolla's New Chapter

The launch of JollaMind² marks a new chapter for Jolla, a company that has consistently pushed the boundaries of mobile innovation. After a decade of focusing on alternative operating systems and app support, Jolla is now fully committed to AI devices. This strategic shift reflects the company's belief in the transformative potential of AI and its determination to create a more secure and private digital landscape.

JollaMind² is more than just a device; it's a testament to Jolla's unwavering commitment to innovation and its vision for a future where technology empowers individuals without compromising their privacy. As we eagerly await its official launch, JollaMind² stands poised to redefine the relationship between humans and AI, ushering in a new era of intelligent and secure computing.

Title: Mobile OS maker Jolla is back and building an AI device
Text:
In the realm of mobile innovation, a new player has emerged, promising to revolutionize the way we interact with artificial intelligence (AI) and safeguard our privacy. Jolla, a Finnish mobile phone startup, is making a comeback with a groundbreaking device that aims to provide users with a secure and private AI experience.

Jolla's latest creation, the JollaMind², is a compact black box that serves as a personal cloud and AI router. It's designed to keep your data private and accessible for running AI queries, acting as a personal server and AI hub. This device taps into the generative AI boom, allowing users to harness the power of AI without compromising their privacy.

The JollaMind² is powered by open-source AI large language models, including Meta's LLaMA 2, providing a solid foundation for generative AI capabilities. The team at Jolla focuses on designing the user interface and function, leveraging the capabilities of these powerful AI models.

Jolla's vision is to empower users with advanced AI capabilities without sacrificing their privacy. They believe that the current AI landscape, dominated by large corporations, poses risks to personal data and privacy. The JollaMind² aims to address this concern by keeping all data processing within the device itself, ensuring that no third parties can access or exploit it.

The device's AI capabilities extend to natural language processing, allowing users to interact with it using conversational language. It can proactively surface insights and information by drawing upon trusted access to the user's mobile data and digital services.

Jolla emphasizes the importance of data security and privacy in the age of generative AI. They argue that the concentration of data in the hands of a few large companies can lead to dangerous outcomes. The JollaMind² offers a solution by providing users with a secure and private hub for all their AI processing needs.

The JollaMind² is designed to seamlessly integrate with mainstream mobile platforms, adding a layer of security and privacy to existing apps and services. Jolla envisions the device evolving into a platform of its own, attracting developers to build apps that operate within its protective wrapper of privacy and security.

Jolla's mission is to democratize AI innovation, preventing a repeat of the past mobile cycle, where Big Tech companies dominated the market. They believe that generative AI has the potential to be a game-changer, but only if it's developed with a focus on privacy and security.

The JollaMind² is currently in the prototype stage, and a sneak peek at its capabilities reveals a promising glimpse into the future of AI-powered assistance. The device can handle natural language queries, contextually relevant responses, and even email triage, all while keeping the user's data secure.

Jolla plans to officially announce its first AI product on May 20, 2023, marking a decade since the company's initial announcement of its Sailfish mobile phone. Pre-ordering is expected to begin at that time, with the JollaMind² hitting the market in Q4 of 2023.

Jolla's return to the mobile scene with a focus on AI innovation is a testament to the ever-evolving nature of technology. The JollaMind² promises to usher in a new era of AI-powered assistance, prioritizing privacy and security without compromising on functionality. As the device takes shape and enters the market, it will be exciting to see how it transforms the way we interact with AI and safeguard our digital lives.

Title: SeatGeek's new tools help fans resell tickets at the best price
Text:
Ticketing Simplified: SeatGeek's Next-Gen Features

SeatGeek, a renowned ticketing platform and resale marketplace, has unveiled a suite of innovative features designed to streamline the ticket-selling experience for users. These features, collectively known as "Next Fan Up," empower sports and music enthusiasts with tools typically reserved for venues, organizations, and licensed sellers.

Smart Pricing: A Revolutionary Approach

At the heart of SeatGeek's Next Fan Up initiative is Smart Pricing, a groundbreaking algorithm that leverages machine learning models to analyze historical sales data, weather conditions, seat locations, and other relevant factors to determine the optimal ticket price. This feature ensures that sellers can price their tickets competitively and maximize their chances of a successful sale.

Seat Perks: Making Tickets Irresistible

Another exciting addition is the Seat Perks feature, which automatically tags each ticket with all its special features and amenities. This includes perks like food and beverage credits, access to exclusive clubs, aisle or front-row seats, accessibility options, and breathtaking skyline views. By highlighting these perks, SeatGeek makes tickets more appealing to potential buyers, increasing their chances of a quick sale.

Bulk Listing: A Time-Saving Solution

Last but not least, SeatGeek introduces the Bulk Listing feature, which allows users to list multiple tickets to various events with a single action. This feature saves users valuable time and eliminates the need to create separate listings for each event. It's particularly beneficial for sellers who deal with a high volume of tickets.

A Brighter Future for Ticketing

SeatGeek's Next Fan Up features represent a significant step forward in the evolution of ticket-selling experiences. These features are designed to empower fans with the tools and resources they need to buy and sell tickets seamlessly, ensuring that every fan has the opportunity to enjoy live events.

Title: MWC 2024: Everything announced so far, including a 'rollable' Motorola concept phone
Text:
MWC 2024: A Glimpse into the Future of Tech

Barcelona is buzzing with excitement as Mobile World Congress 2024 unfolds, showcasing the latest innovations and trends shaping the tech landscape. From groundbreaking gadgets to AI-powered advancements, here are some highlights from the event:

1. Displace's Wireless TV Revolution:

Displace is turning heads with its innovative 55-inch Display Flex, a wireless 4K OLED TV that seamlessly sticks to walls without traditional mounting. CEO Balaji Krishna hints at future versions, including a smaller Display Mini for kitchens and bathrooms, along with AI-powered shopping and contactless payment features.

2. Motorola's Rollable Concept Phone:

Lenovo's rollable concept phone for Motorola is a futuristic marvel. While still in the conceptual stage, this device wraps around your wrist, blurring the line between smartphone and wearable technology.

3. Doublepoint's Gesture-Touch Control for Android Smartwatches:

Android smartwatch users can now experience Doublepoint's WowMouse gesture-touch control app, allowing for intuitive and effortless navigation.

4. Microsoft's AI Access Principles:

Brad Smith, Microsoft's president, unveiled the AI Access Principles, an 11-point framework guiding the company's AI infrastructure and assets worldwide. This move signals Microsoft's commitment to transparency and stakeholder engagement in the realm of AI.

5. Xiaomi's Electric Car Unveiled:

Xiaomi EV's first product, the Xiaomi SU7, is a sleek and high-performance sedan set to hit Chinese roads next year. The vehicle boasts five core EV technologies, including an E-Motor, CTB Integrated Battery, Xiaomi Die Casting, Xiaomi Pilot Autonomous Driving, and Smart Cabin, all powered by the HyperOS operating system.

6. Samsung's Smart Ring for Health and Sleep Tracking:

Samsung's Galaxy Ring is a stylish wearable that monitors heart rate, movement, and breathing to provide insights into the wearer's health and sleep patterns. Details on pricing and battery life are yet to be revealed.

7. OnePlus Watch 2's Extended Battery Life:

OnePlus' upcoming Watch 2 promises an impressive 100 hours of battery life in Smart Mode, a significant improvement over its predecessor. The company's focus on battery technology aims to address a key pain point in the smartwatch market.

8. Xiaomi's CyberDog 2: A More Refined Robotic Companion:

Xiaomi's CyberDog 2, an upgraded version of its robotic dog, made its appearance at MWC. The new model features a more realistic head and improved capabilities, available for purchase online at $3,000.

9. Lenovo's Transparent Laptop Concept:

Lenovo's transparent laptop concept is a futuristic vision of computing, allowing users to see through the screen and keyboard. While still in the conceptual phase, it showcases Lenovo's innovative spirit and design prowess.

10. Google's AI-Powered Features:

Google is integrating AI into its services, introducing new features for phones, cars, and wearables. These include Gemini-powered message crafting, AI-generated image captions, text summarization for Android Auto, and pass access on Wear OS. Additionally, Google Messages will offer in-app access to Gemini, currently in beta and supporting English only.

11. DeepMind's Multimodal Generative AI Tool:

DeepMind founder Demis Hassabis discussed Google's multimodal generative AI tool, Gemini, which can generate images based on text prompts. The tool's ability to depict people was temporarily paused due to concerns about historically incongruous images, but it's expected to be reinstated in the coming weeks.

12. Seaborough's Mood-Enhancing Desktop Lamp:

Seaborough, a Dutch company, showcased compact devices that mimic the sun's impact on serotonin production in the brain. These lamps are designed to improve mood and well-being, plugging into a computer's USB port for power.

13. Infinix's E-Color Shift: A Colorful Twist on E-Ink Screens:

Infinix's E-Color Shift takes e-ink screen technology to the next level, adding color and a unique aesthetic to the often-overlooked back of smartphones.

Conclusion:

Mobile World Congress 2024 is a testament to the rapid pace of innovation in the tech industry. From wireless TVs and rollable phones to AI-powered features and mood-enhancing lamps, these advancements are shaping the future of how we interact with technology and the world around us.

Title: Initia raises $7.5M seed round to simplify blockchain development
Text:
In the ever-evolving realm of cryptocurrencies, Initia, a brainchild of young developers, is making waves by addressing a persistent challenge: the complexity of building blockchain applications.

Initia's mission is to enhance interoperability among multichain networks and simplify the creation of app-specific blockchains, known as app chains. While popular blockchains like Ethereum and Bitcoin dominate the scene, app chains offer developers greater freedom to customize economic and governance structures.

However, this fragmentation of the blockchain landscape creates friction for users, who must navigate diverse gas fees, wallets, and explorers. Initia's co-founder, Ezaan Mangalji, emphasizes the magnitude of this challenge, especially when transferring assets between blockchains.

Initia's solution lies in providing a Layer 1 blockchain network specifically designed to facilitate a system of L2 rollups. These rollups offer scalability and sovereignty, while leveraging the Cosmos SDK for flexibility. In essence, Initia aims to abstract away the technical complexities of app chains, making them more accessible to users and developers alike.

Stan Liu, Initia's other co-founder, envisions a future where thousands of applications are built on crypto without users even realizing it's a crypto project. The goal is to create an "Apple App Store" for crypto applications, ensuring easy access for users.

Initia's recent $7.5 million seed funding, led by Delphi Ventures and HackVC, is a testament to its potential. The startup plans to utilize this investment to expand its ecosystem, enhance its chain and platform, and support Layer 2 applications.

Initia's journey began with a different focus: decentralized finance (DeFi). However, the FTX implosion prompted a pivot towards blockchain infrastructure, recognizing the need to address the fragmentation and complexity issues plaguing current blockchains.

With a team of 20 people spread across the globe, Initia is poised to revolutionize the way blockchain applications are built and used. Its focus on interoperability, simplicity, and scalability has the potential to unlock a new era of innovation in the crypto space.

Title: Spain's Embat, which has raised $16M, plans to compete with Trovata in real-time accounting
Text:
Embat: Streamlining Financial Processes with Real-Time Treasury Management

In the realm of corporate finance, time is a precious commodity. Financial teams often find themselves bogged down by tedious tasks like treasury management, accounting, and bank reconciliation. Embat, a Spanish fintech startup, is tackling these challenges head-on with its innovative real-time treasury management solution.

Embat's Journey: From Inception to Success

Embat was founded in 2021 by a trio of finance experts: Antonio Berga, Carlos Serrano, and Tomás Gil. Their mission was clear: to digitize and automate financial processes, empowering finance teams to work smarter and faster.

The startup's efforts have not gone unnoticed. Embat recently secured $16 million in Series AS funding, led by Creandum, with participation from Samaipata, 4Founders, Venture Friends, and several notable angel investors. This funding will fuel Embat's growth and expansion plans.

Embat's Solution: A Game-Changer for Finance Teams

Embat's real-time treasury management solution is designed to streamline financial processes and save valuable time for finance teams. It automates accounting and bank reconciliation, centralizes collections, payments, and treasury processes, and provides real-time visibility into financial data.

The result? Embat's clients, which include prominent companies like Playtomic, Cabify, Wallapop, and Fever, have experienced significant improvements in efficiency and accuracy.

Embat's Edge: AI and Global Connectivity

Embat's solution stands out in the market due to its focus on AI and global connectivity. The platform leverages AI to reduce errors and improve decision-making for accounting teams. Additionally, Embat's API-driven approach allows clients to connect globally, saving time and money.

Embracing Competition, Driving Innovation

Embat recognizes the presence of competitors in the market, including Kyriba, Sage XRT, and Trovata. However, the startup is confident in its unique approach and the value it brings to clients. Embat's focus on AI, global connectivity, and automated cash accounting sets it apart from the competition.

Embat's Vision: A Future of Seamless Financial Management

Embat is poised to revolutionize the way finance teams operate. With its real-time treasury management solution, the startup is empowering businesses to make faster, more informed decisions, and unlock new levels of efficiency. As Embat continues to grow and innovate, the future of seamless financial management looks brighter than ever.

Title: Writer's latest models can generate text from images including charts and graphs
Text:
In the realm of generative AI, Writer, a San Francisco-based startup, stands out with its focus on creating practical business solutions. Their latest innovation, Palmyra-Vision, is a text-generating model that draws inspiration from images, including charts and graphs.

May Habib, Writer's co-founder and CEO, explains their strategic decision to prioritize multimodal content, emphasizing text output as their core offering. This approach has led them to analyze images rather than produce them, at least for now. Their current focus is on generating text from existing visual data.

Palmyra-Vision employs a multi-model approach, where each model plays a specific role in interpreting the image and generating text with remarkable accuracy. This opens up a world of use cases, such as automating text generation for e-commerce websites, where product descriptions can be effortlessly updated based on changing images. It can also interpret charts and graphs, extracting key insights and takeaways.

Compliance checking is another area where Palmyra-Vision shines. For instance, pharmaceutical companies can leverage the model to ensure that ad copy complies with FDA regulations by comparing it against associated documents.

While Palmyra-Vision can interpret handwritten notes, Habib stresses the importance of training the model for specific use cases, such as medical or insurance, to achieve optimal accuracy.

Habib emphasizes the crucial role of human review in the workflow, as AI models can sometimes hallucinate or make errors. She envisions a more automated workflow in the future, but for now, human oversight remains essential.

Writer has secured $126 million in funding to date and is exploring partnerships with major cloud infrastructure platforms to scale its operations. The latest iteration of Palmyra, featuring image-to-text capabilities, is now available.

Title: Text-to-speech app Speechify launches Gmail integration and voice cloning
Text:
Speechify 3.0: A Revolutionary Text-to-Speech Experience

Speechify, the innovative text-to-speech startup, has unveiled a groundbreaking update to its iOS app, version 3.0. This latest iteration introduces a plethora of exciting features designed to enhance the user experience, making it easier than ever to listen to and engage with written content.

Redesigned Homepage for Seamless Navigation

The revamped homepage serves as a central hub, providing quick and easy access to various import options. Users can effortlessly import files from sources like iOS Files, Google Drive, Kindle, Gmail, Text, Scan, and Link. The intuitive interface ensures a seamless and streamlined experience.

Introducing the Scan Feature: Bringing Physical Documents to Life

Speechify 3.0 introduces a revolutionary scan feature that empowers users to transform physical documents into digital text with just a few taps. This innovative functionality allows users to capture and import printed text, making it accessible for listening anytime, anywhere.

Gmail and Canvas Integration: Unlocking New Horizons of Learning

The app's integration with Gmail streamlines the process of reading emails, allowing users to effortlessly import PDF attachments into Speechify. Additionally, the integration with Canvas, a popular learning management system, provides students with seamless access to their homework assignments, fostering a more engaging and efficient learning experience.

Interactive Widgets: Enhancing Productivity and Convenience

Speechify 3.0 takes advantage of iOS 17's interactive widget feature, introducing new widgets that elevate productivity and convenience. These widgets enable users to import sources, track reading progress, and continue listening to imported documents with ease.

AI-Powered Voice Cloning: A Personalized Reading Experience

Speechify 3.0 introduces a groundbreaking AI-powered feature that allows users to clone their voice and have it read out text. This innovative technology creates a personalized reading experience, making it feel as if the user is reading the text themselves.

Explore Page: A World of Content at Your Fingertips

The redesigned explore page serves as a gateway to a vast collection of content curated by Speechify. This content spans various categories, including productivity, self-improvement, and learning differences. Presented in an engaging Instagram Stories-like format, the explore page offers users a wealth of knowledge and inspiration.

A One-Stop Shop for All Reading Needs

Speechify 3.0 aims to become the ultimate destination for anyone seeking an immersive reading experience. With its comprehensive range of features, including support for external reading sources, AI-powered voice cloning, and a diverse library of content, the app caters to a wide range of users, from casual readers to students and professionals.

Title: Lapse, the app turning your phone into an old-school camera, snaps up $30M
Text:
In a world saturated with digital photography, a refreshing throwback to the analog era is gaining traction. Lapse, a smartphone app, offers a unique experience that harkens back to the days of film cameras and disposable snapshots.

With Lapse, you can capture moments without the instant gratification of seeing them immediately. Instead, you must wait for your photos to "develop," just like in the old days. This adds an element of anticipation and excitement to the process, encouraging users to be more mindful and intentional about their shots.

The app's popularity is evident in its millions of users, 100 million photos captured monthly, and consistent top-10 ranking in the U.S. app store for photographic apps. This success has attracted a new round of funding, totaling $30 million, led by Greylock and DST Global Partners, with participation from previous backers.

Lapse plans to use this funding to enhance the photo experience, explore video capabilities, and potentially introduce monetization strategies that avoid the traditional advertising route.

Behind the scenes, Lapse employs a series of processing steps to optimize the photos, using computer vision and proprietary technology. However, the app has faced criticism for its initial use of growth-hacking tactics, such as forced invites, to expand its user base.

Despite this, Lapse claims to have moved away from these practices and now relies on organic growth and word-of-mouth. However, some users still find the app's interface challenging to navigate, especially when it comes to sharing photos with specific groups of friends.

In the current landscape of consumer apps, Lapse presents an alternative to the dominant social media platforms that have shifted away from sharing with close friends and toward news, entertainment, and influencer content.

Investors see potential in Lapse's focus on simplicity and authenticity, believing it can fill the void left by the evolution of other platforms. The app's unique approach to photo-sharing may resonate with users seeking a more genuine and personal way to connect with their friends.

Title: Zacua Ventures has launched a new $56 million fund dedicated to construction tech
Text:
In the world of construction, technology has often been a slow-moving train. But a new venture capital firm, Zacua Ventures, is aiming to change that by investing in early-stage construction technology startups.

Zacua Ventures has a $56 million fund backed by 19 construction industry giants, including Procore, Volvo, and Cemex. These industry leaders recognize the need for innovation in the construction sector and are eager to support startups that can bring about positive change.

The construction industry is characterized by numerous small and medium-sized companies, which has led to a fragmented adoption of technology. However, this fragmentation also presents a significant opportunity for startups that can address the industry's unique challenges.

Zacua Ventures is particularly interested in startups that focus on sustainability, productivity, and urbanization. The construction industry is responsible for a significant portion of greenhouse gas emissions, and Zacua Ventures believes that startups can play a vital role in reducing this impact. Additionally, the firm is interested in startups that can improve productivity and efficiency in the construction process, as well as those that can contribute to the development of resilient and intelligent structures for the cities of the future.

Since its launch, Zacua Ventures has already invested in a number of promising startups, including Construex, an Ecuador-based software-as-a-service marketplace for the construction and design industries, and Flexnode, a data infrastructure startup.

Zacua Ventures' $56 million fund is a testament to the growing interest in construction technology. The firm is confident that its investments will help to drive innovation in the industry and bring about positive change.

Title: Glean wants to beat ChatGPT at its own game — in the enterprise
Text:
In a world where information overload is a constant struggle, Glean emerges as a savior for enterprise employees seeking answers from vast data pools. This AI-powered search app connects to a company's databases and data stores, transforming plain-English requests into insightful responses.

Fueled by the observation that employees often grapple with finding the information they need to excel at their jobs, Glean was born. Its mission is to enhance productivity, boost energy levels, and improve the overall employee experience by providing quick and accurate answers to various queries.

Glean's journey began as a cognitive search app, similar to Microsoft's SharePoint Syntex and Amazon Kendra. However, it has evolved into a platform that analyzes a company's internal data to provide relevant answers to employee inquiries. This includes information from support tickets, chat messages, and customer relationship management platforms.

While connecting proprietary data to a GenAI platform raises concerns about privacy and data security, Glean assures users of its secure and private nature. It respects the permissions set in a company's data sources, ensuring that employees only receive answers based on the data they're authorized to access. Additionally, Glean employs Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) to ground its responses in external sources of knowledge, making every answer fully referenceable.

Despite competition from tech giants like Microsoft and OpenAI, Glean has experienced remarkable growth, with its annual recurring revenue quadrupling in the past year. This success is attributed to its strong customer base, which includes Duolingo, Grammarly, and Sony.

Glean's recent $200 million Series D funding round, co-led by Kleiner Perkins and Lightspeed Venture Partners, reflects investor confidence in the company's potential. The funds will be utilized to expand teams, enhance the product, and bolster its go-to-market strategy.

Glean's mission to empower enterprise employees with instant access to information is gaining traction. As companies strive to navigate the complexities of the digital age, Glean stands as a beacon of hope, promising to transform the way people work and unlock new levels of productivity.

Title: The Displace wireless TV, that sticks to walls, plans new models and new AI features
Text:
Displace TV: A Revolutionary Wireless TV with Innovative Features

At CES 2023, Displace, a hardware startup, unveiled the 'Display Flex', a 55-inch wireless 4K OLED TV that adheres to walls without the need for traditional mounting. This innovative TV created a buzz, and now, at Mobile World Congress in Barcelona, founder and CEO Balaji Krishna has revealed plans for new models and features.

Expanding the Displace Lineup: Introducing the 'Display Mini'

The Displace family is growing with the introduction of the 'Display Mini', a compact 27-inch TV designed for smaller spaces like kitchens and bathrooms. This TV offers the same wireless convenience and sleek design as the larger model, making it an ideal choice for those seeking a more compact TV experience.

AI-Powered Shopping and Contactless Payment: The Future of TV

Displace is not just about providing a wireless TV; it also aims to revolutionize the way we interact with our screens. The upcoming models will feature an "AI-powered shopping engine" that allows viewers to purchase products directly from advertisements. This seamless shopping experience eliminates the need to switch between devices or search for products online, making it a convenient and immersive way to shop.

In addition, the Displace TVs will incorporate a contactless payment reader, enabling viewers to make purchases without leaving their seats. This feature adds a layer of convenience and security, making it a breeze to pay for digital content or other services.

Health Applications: Taking TV to the Next Level

Displace TVs will also feature a built-in thermal camera with potential health applications. This camera can read body heat maps to detect inflammation, providing valuable insights into one's health and well-being. This feature has the potential to transform the TV into a personal health assistant, offering proactive and personalized healthcare monitoring.

Availability and Future Plans

Displace is currently fulfilling pre-orders for the 'Display Flex' and plans to start shipping mid-year. The company is also aiming to secure a $5 million Series A funding round to support its growth and development.

While most consumers are accustomed to traditional TV setups, Displace has garnered significant interest from art studios, museums, and even embassies. These organizations appreciate the unique mounting capabilities of the Displace TV, which allow for flexible placement on walls or even windows.

How Does the Displace TV Work?

The Displace TV uses a vacuum suction system to attach to various surfaces, including dry walls. It features swappable batteries that power the screen, eliminating the need for unsightly cables. The TV streams content from a base station, similar to LG's OLED M.

The 'Display Flex' can stay on the wall for up to 10 months using its vacuum system. In case of a power outage or system failure, the screen gradually lowers itself using a zipline-like mechanism, ensuring a safe and controlled descent.

Title: MoneyHash raises $4.5M for its payment orchestration platform serving merchants in MENA
Text:
In the Middle East and Africa (MEA), the world of money moves in a unique and complex dance. With a diverse tapestry of payment providers and methods, evolving regulations, and a kaleidoscope of customer preferences, navigating this financial labyrinth is no easy feat. Throw in challenges like payment fraud, low checkout success rates, and transaction failures, and you've got a recipe for complexity that would make even the most seasoned financial acrobat dizzy.

But fear not, for a new player has emerged on the scene, ready to orchestrate this symphony of payments: MoneyHash, an Egyptian fintech company, is stepping up to the plate with a mission to simplify and streamline the payment process for merchants across the region.

With a recent $4.5 million seed investment, MoneyHash is poised to revolutionize the way businesses accept and manage payments. Their secret weapon? A unified payment API that acts as a maestro, conducting the flow of money seamlessly and efficiently.

This API maestro integrates various payment gateways and processors, enabling merchants to connect with a vast network of payment options without the hassle of dealing with multiple providers. It's like having a universal remote control for your payment needs, allowing you to switch channels effortlessly.

But MoneyHash doesn't stop there. They've also got a customizable checkout experience, transaction routing capabilities with fraud and failure rate optimizers, and a centralized transaction reporting hub. It's like having a payment command center at your fingertips, giving you real-time visibility and control over every transaction.

The result? Merchants can say goodbye to payment headaches and hello to a smoother, more efficient payment journey. They can focus on growing their businesses while MoneyHash takes care of the nitty-gritty details of payment processing.

But MoneyHash isn't just about technology; they're also about collaboration. They've joined forces with leading payment service providers (PSPs) to ensure that merchants have access to the best and most secure payment solutions. This partnership approach is like a symphony of expertise, where MoneyHash and PSPs work together to create a harmonious payment experience.

With MoneyHash, merchants can tap into a vast network of integrations, gain access to a team of payment experts, and leverage their deep knowledge to navigate the complexities of the MEA payment landscape. It's like having a trusted guide through a foreign land, helping you avoid pitfalls and find the smoothest path to success.

So, if you're a merchant looking to simplify your payment processes, optimize your checkout experience, and reduce fraud and transaction failures, MoneyHash is your maestro. With their innovative platform and collaborative approach, they're poised to revolutionize the way businesses accept and manage payments in the MEA region.

Title: Microsoft made a $16 million investment in Mistral AI
Text:
In the realm of artificial intelligence, a new player has emerged, poised to challenge the dominance of OpenAI's GPT-4. Mistral AI, a Paris-based AI startup, unveiled its latest creation, Mistral Large, a formidable language model designed to rival the best in the industry.

But that's not all. Mistral AI has secured a strategic partnership with tech giant Microsoft, marking a significant milestone in its journey. This partnership involves a €15 million investment from Microsoft, signaling their confidence in Mistral AI's potential.

The investment, however, comes with a twist. Microsoft's stake in Mistral AI will depend on the valuation of the startup's next funding round. This unique arrangement ensures that Mistral AI's valuation remains intact, while Microsoft's equity stake remains flexible.

Mistral AI's journey has been nothing short of remarkable. In December 2023, the company garnered a valuation of approximately $2 billion, thanks to a successful funding round led by Andreessen Horowitz. Prior to that, Mistral AI had secured $112 million in seed funding shortly after its inception.

The unveiling of Mistral Large marks a significant step forward for the company. Unlike its predecessors, Mistral Large is not open-source, and developers can access it exclusively through Mistral's API platform. This strategic move positions Mistral AI as a formidable competitor in the large language model landscape.

To further expand its reach, Mistral AI has forged a distribution partnership with Microsoft Azure. This alliance opens up new avenues for Mistral AI to attract customers, particularly those within the Microsoft ecosystem. Azure customers can now seamlessly integrate Mistral's models into their applications, gaining access to cutting-edge AI capabilities.

The partnership between Microsoft and Mistral AI has garnered attention from regulators, particularly the European Commission (EC). The EC has expressed its intention to scrutinize the deal, underscoring the growing importance of generative AI companies and their potential impact on the tech landscape.

While Mistral AI initially positioned itself as a European AI champion, its recent moves, including the closed-source approach and the involvement of American backers, have raised questions about its commitment to European values.

As the AI landscape continues to evolve, Mistral AI's partnership with Microsoft and the unveiling of Mistral Large signal a new era of competition in the realm of large language models. The coming months will reveal how these developments shape the future of AI and its impact on various industries.

Title: How Does AI Classify? Top Insights On How We Train Models
Text:
Unveiling the Enigma: Probing the Limits of AI Classification

In the realm of artificial intelligence (AI), we often encounter questions that challenge our understanding of these technologies. One such question, posed by MIT CSAIL Assistant Professor Dylan Hadfield-Menell, delves into the complexities of measuring AI's capabilities, particularly in the context of computer vision and classification.

Hadfield-Menell begins by asserting that data is a subjective property of the world, emphasizing the need for critical thinking when evaluating AI systems. He presents a thought-provoking example: a picture of a cat. Is it truly an image of a cat, or is it merely a collection of pixels that have been manipulated? This question becomes even more intricate when we introduce synthetic data, which raises the issue of adversarial examples.

Adversarial examples are slight, often imperceptible changes made to an image that can cause a machine learning classifier to misclassify it. Hadfield-Menell poses a intriguing question: if a classifier misclassifies a modified image of a cat, is it wrong? Or is it simply responding to the altered data?

The key takeaway here is that the data used to program AI systems is more akin to a computer program than a reflection of the real world. We instruct AI systems on what to do by providing examples of good and bad outputs. However, this approach has limitations.

Data selection, Hadfield-Menell argues, is a form of programming. When we choose data to train AI systems, we are essentially specifying a subjective idea of what we want the system to do. This subjectivity can lead to confusion and misinterpretations, as we saw with the recent ChatGPT "hullabaloo."

The challenge lies in effectively communicating the goal of the subjective choices made by AI designers. This ability to explain the targeting and nature of AI model work is crucial for realizing the full benefits of AI.

Hadfield-Menell's insights provide valuable fodder for thought, especially for students who are shaping the future of AI. As they craft elevator pitches, develop models, and attempt to define AI, they must grapple with these fundamental questions.

Stay tuned for more insights from our esteemed guests as we continue to explore the fascinating world of AI!

Title: Mastering Service Intelligence 2.0
Text:
Service Intelligence 2.0: Enhancing Issue Resolution with Master Data Management Principles

In the ever-evolving realm of customer service, the ability to swiftly resolve issues is paramount to maintaining customer satisfaction. Master data management (MDM) principles, traditionally applied to structured data, are now being harnessed in the form of Service Intelligence 2.0 to revolutionize issue resolution efficiency.

Consolidation: Unifying Disparate Knowledge Sources

Imagine a technician struggling to locate relevant information scattered across multiple platforms and applications. Service Intelligence 2.0 addresses this challenge by consolidating knowledge from various sources into a unified platform. This consolidation goes beyond technical integration; it involves establishing a cohesive repository of consolidated knowledge, encompassing both structured and unstructured data.

Cleansing: Transforming Raw Data into Actionable Insights

Consolidation alone is insufficient. Data often arrives in diverse formats and with varying degrees of reliability. Service Intelligence 2.0 employs advanced techniques like custom large language models and reference data checks to cleanse and standardize data. This process disambiguates variations in terminology and enhances data interpretation, enabling the identification of similar or divergent resolution paths.

Governance: Ensuring Accuracy and Alignment with Organizational Objectives

Before sharing insights across the organization, it's crucial to ensure their accuracy and alignment with organizational objectives. Service Intelligence 2.0 incorporates governance mechanisms to scrutinize acquired knowledge for potential biases or undesirable patterns. Subject matter experts play a vital role in this process, verifying insights, recommending additional steps, and identifying gaps that require attention.

Sharing: Democratizing Data and Empowering Technicians

With a unified repository of intelligent systems in place, organizations can democratize data previously dispersed across silos. Service Intelligence 2.0 enables technicians to access this shared data, fostering collaboration and informed decision-making. The impact of this initiative is reflected in improved service key performance indicators (KPIs).

Conclusion: Embracing MDM Principles for Service Excellence

Service data is dynamic, with manuals, knowledge articles, and new cases continuously evolving. The processes of consolidation, cleansing, and governance are ongoing, ensuring the service intelligence platform remains up-to-date and effective. By mastering MDM principles, organizations can harness the power of Service Intelligence 2.0 to drive informed decision-making, foster collaboration, and deliver unparalleled service excellence in today's competitive landscape.

Title: Decoding Small Business Failures: Top Four Contributing Factors
Text:
Navigating the Entrepreneurial Maze: Lessons from Small Business Failures

In the dynamic realm of entrepreneurship, small businesses stand as beacons of innovation and economic growth. Yet, the path to success is often strewn with challenges. Understanding the reasons behind small business failures can be a valuable guide for aspiring and established entrepreneurs alike.

1. Underestimating the Power of Sales and Marketing:

Sales and marketing are the lifeblood of any business, regardless of its size. Even the most groundbreaking ideas can falter without consistent sales growth. Many small businesses underestimate the significance of a robust sales and marketing strategy. This is especially true for entrepreneurs who may not have a natural inclination towards sales. However, developing these skills or partnering with experts in the field is crucial for success.

2. Inadequate Preparation: A Recipe for Failure:

Insufficient preparation can sabotage even the most promising ventures. It's not just about having a great idea; it's about deeply understanding the landscape in which that idea must thrive. This involves thorough research into the industry, competitors, target audience, and financial requirements.

Financial preparedness is often overlooked but essential. Entrepreneurs must realistically assess the costs of launching and operating their business. They should also have a financial cushion to support operations until profitability is achieved.

3. Insufficient Effort: The Key Ingredient Missing:

The journey of a small business is not just about ideas and innovation; it's about the sheer effort and hard work required to make it a success. Insufficient effort is often a critical factor in the failure of small businesses. This includes not just physical effort but also mental and emotional investment. The willingness to work harder and learn more than others is a crucial differentiator in the world of entrepreneurship.

4. Lack of Knowledge: A Critical Gap:

A common reason for small business failures is a lack of knowledge. Intelligence and a thirst for learning are essential traits for entrepreneurs. Understanding digital marketing, online sales channels, and industry regulations can give a small business a competitive edge. Continuous learning through courses, workshops, and industry publications is crucial. Staying updated with trends, networking with professionals, and embracing technology and innovation are also key.

Conclusion:

The road to entrepreneurial success is challenging, but it's a path that can lead to financial freedom and personal fulfillment. By understanding and overcoming the common reasons for failure, entrepreneurs can set themselves up for success. Are you ready to rise to the challenge and navigate your way to business triumph?

Title: Nintendo Reveals Pokémon Legends Z-A With A Far Off Release Date
Text:
Pokémon Legends Z-A: A Journey Through Kalos

In an exciting revelation, Nintendo has unveiled Pokémon Legends Z-A, the latest installment in the beloved Pokémon franchise. This highly anticipated game marks the triumphant return of Mega Evolutions, much to the delight of countless fans. Set in the captivating region of Kalos, the game promises an immersive adventure that will transport players to a world of wonder and discovery.

However, there's a catch: Pokémon Legends Z-A is not expected to grace our screens until 2025, hinting at a potential launch alongside the rumored Nintendo Switch 2. This news has sparked speculation among eager fans, who wonder how Nintendo will fill the gap in their release schedule.

Despite the wait, the enthusiasm for Pokémon Legends Z-A is palpable. The prospect of exploring the vibrant region of Kalos, encountering new Pokémon, and experiencing the thrill of Mega Evolutions has ignited excitement within the Pokémon community.

This extended development period offers hope for a meticulously crafted game, one that surpasses the quality of recent Pokémon titles. Fans have expressed concerns about the perceived decline in graphical fidelity and performance in recent installments, particularly when compared to other Switch games.

However, if Pokémon Legends Z-A indeed launches on the next-generation Switch console, it could unleash the full potential of the Pokémon world. Imagine the possibilities: stunning visuals, seamless gameplay, and immersive experiences that push the boundaries of what we've seen before.

While we eagerly await the arrival of Pokémon Legends Z-A, let's celebrate the promise it holds. This game has the potential to be a groundbreaking entry in the franchise, offering a captivating adventure that will captivate players of all ages. The journey to Kalos may be long, but it's one that promises to be well worth the wait.

Title: A Value Realization Framework For Digital Transformation Projects
Text:
Harnessing the Power of Digital Transformation: A Value Realization Framework

In the ever-evolving landscape of technology, digital transformation initiatives have become increasingly intricate, demanding a strategic approach that is both agile and anticipatory. This blog explores a value realization framework designed to address the challenges of digital transformation, aligning initiatives with the evolving expectations and needs of customers.

The Value Realization Framework: A Path to Success

This framework serves as a methodical approach for organizations aiming to:

- Translate digital strategies into tangible business value, focusing on outcomes such as business growth, productivity enhancement, cost reduction, and risk mitigation.

- Consider the long-term impact of digital transformations on strategic goals, encouraging a future-oriented mindset to address emerging challenges and seize new opportunities.

- Enable organizational leaders to deliver lasting capabilities that provide value for end customers, shareholders, employees, and the community.

Four Key Phases for Effective Transformation

1. Define: Desired Business Value Outcomes

- Clearly define the ideal outcome, whether a product or service, and plan the path to its realization from the endpoint backward.

- Specify objectives, identify key metrics, and continuously align the transformation strategy with the changing business landscape.

2. Dive Deep: Current State Assessment

- Conduct a comprehensive assessment of existing system capabilities, analyzing data, identifying bottlenecks, and pinpointing areas for improvement.

- Focus on customer challenges, benefits, and experience redefinition, utilizing data metrics to understand pain points.

3. Deploy: Measure Transformation Outcome At Scale

- Quantify results using strategic management tools like OKRs, KPIs, and the Business Model Canvas.

- Monitor cost savings, staff productivity, operational resilience, and business agility through calculated impacts.

4. Optimize: Review And Recalibrate

- Periodically reassess the value-based decision-making framework to ensure alignment with the organization's strategic direction.

- Employ data from business value reports to fine-tune processes for improved efficiency and effectiveness.

Conclusion: A Framework for Sustainable Success

This value realization framework provides a structured approach for organizations to track and quantify the benefits of digital transformation. By embedding it into the organizational culture, fostering a mindset of ongoing evaluation, learning, and adaptation, organizations can continually capture and maximize the benefits of digital transformation, ensuring sustainable success in the digital age.

Title: Samsung becomes first to introduce 12-stack HBM3E amid high demand from AI
Text:
Samsung's High-Bandwidth Memory Revolution: Unlocking New Possibilities with 12-Stack HBM3E DRAM

In a groundbreaking feat of engineering, Samsung has unveiled the industry's first 12-stack HBM3E DRAM, pushing the boundaries of high bandwidth memory technology to unprecedented heights. This remarkable innovation marks a significant leap forward in memory capacity and bandwidth, opening up new avenues for data-intensive applications and AI-powered advancements.

Unparalleled Performance and Capacity: A Game-Changer for Data-Hungry Applications

The HBM3E 12H DRAM boasts an impressive maximum bandwidth of 1,280GB/s, a staggering 50% increase compared to its 8-stack predecessor. This lightning-fast data transfer rate empowers data centers, AI systems, and high-performance computing platforms to process massive datasets and complex algorithms with unparalleled efficiency.

Complementing its exceptional bandwidth, the HBM3E 12H DRAM also boasts an impressive capacity of 36GB, a 50% increase over the 8-stack HBM3. This expanded capacity allows for the storage and processing of even larger datasets, enabling advancements in AI model training, scientific simulations, and real-time analytics.

Stacking Up to the Challenge: Achieving Density without Compromising Height

At the heart of the HBM3E 12H DRAM's remarkable performance lies Samsung's innovative thermal compression non-conductive film (TC NCF) technology. This advanced material enables the stacking of twelve DRAM modules, each with a capacity of 24 gigabits (Gb) or 3 gigabytes (GB), without compromising the chip's overall height.

By utilizing TC NCF, Samsung has achieved a vertical density that is over 20% greater than the 8-stack HBM3, while maintaining compatibility with existing package requirements. This breakthrough in stacking technology paves the way for even higher capacity HBM solutions in the future.

Empowering AI and Data Center Advancements: Unleashing the Potential of High-Performance Computing

The HBM3E 12H DRAM is poised to revolutionize AI and data center operations, enabling a new era of accelerated computing and enhanced efficiency. For AI applications, the increased bandwidth and capacity of the HBM3E 12H DRAM can significantly reduce AI training times and boost the number of simultaneous users for inference services.

In data centers, the HBM3E 12H DRAM's exceptional performance and capacity can optimize server utilization, reduce latency, and improve overall system responsiveness. This translates to faster data processing, improved application performance, and a lower total cost of ownership for data center operators.

A Glimpse into the Future: Mass Production and Industry Impact

Samsung has already provided samples of the HBM3E 12H DRAM to customers, signaling the imminent arrival of this groundbreaking technology. Mass production is expected to commence within the first half of 2023, bringing the benefits of HBM3E 12H DRAM to a wide range of industries and applications.

As the industry embraces the HBM3E 12H DRAM, we can anticipate a surge in innovation across various sectors. From AI and machine learning to data analytics and high-performance computing, the HBM3E 12H DRAM is poised to unlock new possibilities and drive the next wave of technological advancements.

Title: Is your next home assistant a hologram? These MWC concepts offer 3 possibilities
Text:
Journey Through the Future of Communication: Unveiling Deutsche Telekom's Concept T

In the ever-evolving landscape of communication, Deutsche Telekom's Concept T takes us on a captivating journey into the future. This visionary concept combines cutting-edge technologies like AI, hologram telephony, Wi-Fi sensing, computer vision, and Web 3 to redefine how we connect and interact.

Meet Emma, the AI-powered avatar at the heart of Concept T's "Concept view" design study. Through holographic interactions, Emma offers personalized assistance, from styling advice to cryptocurrency management. She's your digital companion, ready to guide you through life's complexities.

Next, "Concept level" reimagines the traditional router into a customizable command center. Its modular design allows you to add elements like a cylindrical display with an AI voice assistant and a cone-shaped module for Wi-Fi sensing and room monitoring. Each module is wirelessly powered, eliminating the hassle of tangled cables.

Finally, "Concept buddy" introduces a charming robotic companion with a smiley face and a range of capabilities. This friendly butler moves around your home, monitoring air quality, projecting information, and ensuring everything runs smoothly. It's like having a personal assistant who's always there to help.

Deutsche Telekom's Concept T is a glimpse into a future where communication is seamless, intuitive, and personalized. It's a testament to the boundless possibilities of technology and the ever-changing nature of human connection.

Title: Superna Expands Its Data Security Offerings With New Threat Protection Technology
Text:
Superna's Acquisition of DefendX: A Leap Forward in Cyberstorage and Data Security

In a bold move to address the challenges of data fragmentation and expand its cyberstorage capabilities, Superna, a leading provider of data management and protection software, has acquired DefendX, a data security innovator. This strategic acquisition marks a significant step forward in Superna's mission to deliver comprehensive, multi-platform data security solutions to its customers.

Cyberstorage: A New Frontier in Data Security

In today's digital landscape, organizations face the dual challenge of monetizing unstructured data across multiple platforms while protecting their growing data estates from sophisticated cyber threats. Traditional data protection technologies often fall short in addressing these challenges, leaving organizations vulnerable to data breaches and security incidents.

Cyberstorage, an emerging security category, offers a data-first approach to security, providing increased resiliency against modern cyber threats. By sitting between network infrastructure and storage systems, cyberstorage solutions like Superna's excel in delivering comprehensive data security across cloud and on-premises environments.

DefendX: A Proven Leader in Data Security

Founded in 1994, DefendX has established itself as a trusted provider of data security solutions, helping customers optimize primary storage space, identify irrelevant files, and securely organize essential data. Their solutions also closely monitor important files and user access to ensure security and enforce compliance.

Superna's acquisition of DefendX brings together two industry leaders in data security and cyberstorage. This merger will enable Superna to extend its powerful security capabilities, close the data security gap left by traditional technologies, and enhance its Data Orchestration portfolio.

A Comprehensive Data Security Solution

The integration of DefendX's innovative capabilities with Superna's industry-leading data protection will provide customers with a Hybrid Cloud Zero Trust Security model for their unstructured data. This comprehensive solution will empower organizations to proactively detect, defend, and recover from unknown threats, reducing cybersecurity exposure and allowing them to focus on leveraging their data for business growth.

A New Era of Data Security and Cyberstorage

The acquisition of DefendX marks a new era for Superna and the data security landscape. By combining their expertise and technologies, Superna and DefendX will deliver cutting-edge cyberstorage solutions that address the evolving needs of organizations in the digital age. With a focus on multi-platform data security and automated, next-generation cyber defense, Superna is poised to lead the way in protecting unstructured data and empowering organizations to unlock its full potential.

Title: Mistral partners with Microsoft, announces new large AI model with chat app
Text:
Mistral Unveils Its Latest AI Model and Forges a Strategic Partnership with Microsoft

In the realm of artificial intelligence, Mistral AI, a company that made waves with its unique Word Art logo and record-breaking seed funding, has unveiled its latest creation: Mistral Large, a cutting-edge text generation model designed for enterprises. This remarkable model boasts impressive capabilities, including multilingual reasoning, text understanding, transformation, and even code generation.

Mistral Large: A Multilingual Powerhouse

Mistral Large stands out as a multilingual model, capable of understanding, reasoning, and generating text in various languages, including English, French, Spanish, German, and Italian. This feature sets it apart from other multilingual models by offering a nuanced understanding of grammar and cultural context, resulting in more accurate and contextually relevant outputs.

Azure AI Partnership: Expanding Accessibility

To further its reach, Mistral has forged a strategic partnership with Microsoft, a move that brings Mistral's open and commercial models, including Mistral Large, to Azure AI Studio and Azure Machine Learning. This partnership marks a significant milestone, making Mistral the second company to offer its commercial language models on Azure.

Seamless Integration and Dedicated Support

Azure users can seamlessly integrate Mistral's models using their existing credits, ensuring a smooth user experience. Additionally, Mistral offers direct access to its support team for customers coming through Azure, providing dedicated assistance and guidance.

Chat App: Exploring Mistral's Potential

To showcase the capabilities of its models and facilitate their adoption, Mistral has launched a chat app, a multilingual conversational assistant that allows users to interact with Mistral's models in a pedagogical and engaging manner. This app serves as a platform for businesses to explore the potential of Mistral's models within their specific business contexts.

Fine-tuning for Enterprise Needs

Mistral is also developing an enterprise-centric version of its chat app, tailored to meet the unique requirements of businesses. This version will feature self-deployment capabilities and fine-grained moderation, empowering organizations to customize the assistant's responses and ensure alignment with their specific policies and guidelines.

Conclusion: A Promising Future for AI

With the launch of Mistral Large, its partnership with Microsoft, and the introduction of its chat app, Mistral AI continues to push the boundaries of AI innovation. The company's commitment to making generative AI ubiquitous and accessible to all holds immense promise for the future of AI and its impact on various industries and applications.
